reviewText: I am outraged by the garbage presented here by NBC. I pre-ordered this and will never do so again. I was hoping to see the opening and closing ceremony as they ruined them when shown live. All you get is a couple of minutes of each - but hey you do get all of the beach volleyball final!!!!!! I mean who really gives a hoot about beach volleyball? This is the worst thing I have ever bought from Amazon, NBC need to hang their collective heads in shame.As I am a British ex-pat living in the US I do own a multi-region DVD player so I guess I have to go and buy the BBC version.Please don't waste your money on this junk, NBC don't deserve to make any money out of this.BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD
summary: BAD BAD BAD BAD and BAD
Title: N/A

reviewText: Aside from this being full screen SD and only 2 discs, NBC's coverage was awful. Not paying to hear the same awful, inaccurate commentary and see the same edits. BBC have one out in October with 3 discs on amazon uk. Not sure of the region, but if I have to buy a new region free blu ray player to watch it, I will.

reviewText: Have enjoyed the highlight dvd.  Would have liked to see more entire races besides the sprints.Was so sick of watching the gymnastics and swimming from the live Olympics, probably won't even view that dvd.

reviewText: It is disgraceful that this release does not offer the complete Opening and Closing Ceremonies.  Without a doubt the BBC will do a much better job.  I only hope it will be a region free offering.  Save your money on this very poor product.

reviewText: It absolutely shocks me how bad NBC screwed up coverage of the London Olympics and now this. It makes absolutely NO SENSE that the FULL opening and closing ceremonies will not be included on this blu ray...but this is NBC, I really shouldn't be that shocked. Nice job dropping the ball once again...
summary: Insulting That This Will Only Include Highlights
Title: N/A

reviewText: So I bit the bullet and purchased this set.  First of all the packaging is flimsy and it did not have any inserts, and the first disc was not in the holder when I opened it up.  I didn't pop in the first disc, but started with the second as that has the special features, swimming, gymnastics, and track footage.First of all since this is a blu ray it is in widescreen HD and not like, the 4:3 or full screen.Now on to the special features - that's all they can come up with after all the fluff that aired on TV??  One on Phelps, and Walsh-May, and then some brief clips of so-called "women of team USA" but only showed the crew, a brief women's basketball recap, and a way too short women's soccer recap.  That's it for women of team USA, apparently.They also had the entire Walsh-May gold medal winning game,  although I did not watch it so not sure if it was edited or not.I did not watch the swimming portion but I watched the gymnastics footage.  There is no fluff included in here as well.  They did have the intros to the men's team, and as well as the women's team but that's all they had.  As far as the events they showed several dudes which I never really bothered with.For the women's side, the events are broken down as follows:1.  Team qualifications - did not show a lot of the events, for example only showed one of McKayla's vaults, and also cut out the fluff pieces.  It was also heavily edited.  They also showed Aly's interview at the end.2.  Team final - focused on US events of course, heavily edited, only showing portions of the performances.  It had McKayla's vault, and then the other girls performances as well but some were cut, only portions of Gabby's floor, and portions of Jordyn's bars were shown.  I think Kyla's beam was edited too.  No team reactions and interactions are shown.  The whole Aly floor was shown however as that is the clincher, and they showed the medal ceremony and national anthem.  They cut portions of the scoreboard watching and played some weird score in the background.3. All around final - focused on the US women too, but showed some of the Russian, Chinese, and Romanian contenders.  Medal ceremony ommited the anthem.4.  Event Finals - they included McKayla's botched vault, but not the "unimpressed" medal ceremony, and also had Aly's beam routine and the protest which awarded her the bronze, and then the entire floor in which she won the gold.That is all that they had and it faded to black.UPDATE: I finally popped in the first disc and it was the ultimate in ridiculousness.  They aired the prologue that was shown on TV - but after that we get an extremely truncated opening ceremony, and then 2 minute highlights of each day's winners.  Some sports were like 5 seconds, like say wrestling where they just show the winning takedown, and heck even Gabby's gold medal got like what, 10 seconds.  What a pathetic "highlight" reel.  You can skip through the days but that's about it.  I can't belive this was approved.  It feels like a sampler.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Watching the Olympics on NBC was like watching life in the game pong.  It made me nauseous!  And these artists and olympians worked their backsides off and this is how you repay them!?  Blahkkk!  Instead I was FORCED to seek other means, yes that's right NBC I dare you to sue me, in order to watch what I wanted, in its entirety!  NBC is run by the purest of incompetence.  It's like having Fox News in charge of truth... it can't be handled by them!!  Unless NBC, whom did not respond to any of my direct queries, puts out an entire double disc of the unedited opening and closing ceremonies, I will stick to the footage I acquired elsewhere!  And let this be a lesson NBC... don't try to get the rights to this again... no one will watch it!!!  London Olympics are so close to my heart and you ruined it for everyone in America!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: By Jim Clark, publisher, Lee County Courier, Tupelo, MississippiFor most the 2012 Olympics held in London covered so many events, over many days that it became overwhelming to watch it all. If you found yourself in that category I have good news.London 2012: Games of the XXX Olympiad the DVD can catch you up with some of the most astonishing camera work you've ever seen. Once the DVD gets into the actual events, be forewarned, things move quickly but they had to considering approximately 4,700 Olympic and Paralympic medals were handed out.I was most impressed with the opening ceremony, directed by Danny Boyle. Boyle (born 20 October 1956) is an English film director and producer, best known for his work on films such as Slumdog Millionaire, Shallow Grave, 127 Hours, 28 Days Later, Sunshine and Trainspotting.I was not alone. Over 24 million viewers watched, making this the largest audience for any British television broadcast since 1996. One of the crowning moments was a spoof with Daniel Craig playing James Bond and the Queen being herself, parachuting in."She was fun, incredibly game. We had a short space of time and I was a bit grumpy as it was my day off and suddenly I am at the Palace with the queen at her private chamber," Craig said. "'It wasn't supposed to be funny. It was supposed to be serious." Obviously, to promote the latest Bond film, Skyfall, which is to release later this month. Adele has confirmed she has written and recorded the theme song for the movie.
summary: All you need to relive  London 2012 Olympics
